intro: Calceolaria stachydifolia, commonly known as the woolly slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, slipper-shaped flowers that are often brightly colored. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves that give it a fuzzy appearance, and it thrives in cool, moist environments. It is typically found in high-altitude grasslands and rocky areas. Calceolaria stachydifolia is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
